Domonic: Generate HTML with Python 3Â¶

  • Index

  • Search Page

Domonic Not only a Python library for generating HTML

Domonic contains several main packages:

(but by no means are any of them complete)

  • html : Generate html with python 3 ðŸ˜Ž

  • dom : DOM API in python 3 ðŸ˜²

  • javascript : js API in python 3 ðŸ˜³

  • terminal || cmd : call terminal commands with python3 ðŸ˜± (see at the end)

  • JSON : utils for loading / decorating / transformin

  • SVG : Generate svg using python (untested

  • aframe || x3d tags : auto generate 3d worlds with aframe. (see examples folder

  • dQuery - Utils for querying domonic. (alt + 0 for the Âº symbol)

  • geom - vec2, vec3 with _dunders_ as well as shape classes

HTML TEMPLATINGÂ¶

from domonic.html import *

  output = render(
      html(
          head(
              style(),
              script(),
          ),
          body(
              div("hello world"),
              a("this is a link", _href="http://www.somesite.com", _style="font-size:10px;"),
              ol(''.join([f'{li()}' for thing in range(5)])),
              h1("test", _class="test"),
          )
      )
  )

<html><head><style></style><script></script></head><body><div>hello world</div><a href="http://www.somesite.com" style="font-size:10px;">this is a link</a><ol><li></li><li></li><li></li><li></li><li></li></ol><h1 class="test">test</h1></body></html>

installÂ¶

python3 -m pip install domonic

or if you had it before upgrade:

python3 -m pip install domonic --upgrade

usageÂ¶

print(html(body(h1('Hello, World!'))))

<html><body><h1>Hello, World!</h1></body></html>

CLIÂ¶

Thereâ€™s a few args you can pass to domonic on the command line to help you out.

To launch the docs for a quick reference to the APIs use:

python3 -m domonic -h

This command will attempt to generate a template from a webpage. (only simple pages for now)

python3 -m domonic -d http://eventual.technology

Then you can edit/tweak it to get what you need and build new components quicker.

INSTALLING - (linux/mac only)

If you like you can install domonic to your .bashprofile

python3 -m domonic --install

Now in your terminal whenever you want to start a new project you can typeâ€¦

project mycoolproject

and it will smash out a basic project for you.

you can also now access the docs quickly simply by typingâ€¦

domonic -h

Finally, you can open and edit .bashprofile to tweak it to your own preferences.

Join-InÂ¶

Feel free to join in if you find it useful.

If thereâ€™s any methods you want that are missing or not complete yet. Just update the code and send a pull request.

Iâ€™ll merge and releaese asap.

EXAMPLE PROJECTÂ¶

A browser based file browser. Working example of how components can work: https://github.com/byteface/Blueberry/

A cron viewer: https://github.com/byteface/ezcron/

DisclaimerÂ¶

Thereâ€™s several more widely supported libraries doing HTML generation, DOM reading/manipulation, terminal wrappers etc. Maybe use one of those for production due to strictness and support.

This is becoming more of a fast prototyping library.

domonic
